page.title: 19Equipment in School
page.content: In 1953 books and paper were in short supply.The teacher made the ink from powder,and children used dip pens.In 1985 cartridge pens are the most popular tool,but various disposable pens are common.Felt pens have not fully replaced wax and pencil crayons, both of which were used frugally in 1953.Paper,paint,adhesives and pencils have improved in variety and quality over the years.The old utility pencil _allowance 2 per year_ carried road safety rules.In 1985 pencils still have road safety rules, or sometimes anti_smoking slogans.32 years ago the school had a piano,an old radio, and an antique gramophone.The headteacher had her own film strip projector and a typewriter.There was no telephone.Now there are modern aids _ an overhead projector,duplicator,record players,a heatcopier,a computer and a telephone.
